Package Monitors

Class Paddock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Monitors.Paddock

  • public class Paddock
extends java.lang.Object
    The Paddock class is a monitor that contains necessary methods to be used in mutual exclusive access by Horses and Spectators.

    This is where the Horses are paraded for the Spectators.

    Since:
    2018-03-21
    See Also:
    HorseRace, Broker, Horse, Spectator

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Paddock​()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static HorseInPaddock goCheckHorses​()
      Function in which the Spectator enters the Paddock.
      static void proceedToPaddock​(int horseID, int pnk)
      The Horses enter the paddock and add their information to the horsesInPaddock array, then they wait until all the Spectators have reached the Paddock, at the end the last Horse awakes the Spectators.
      static void proceedToStartLine​()
      Called by the Horse to exit the Paddock.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Paddock

        public Paddock​()

    • Method Detail

      • proceedToPaddock

        public static void proceedToPaddock​(int horseID,
                                    int pnk)
        The Horses enter the paddock and add their information to the horsesInPaddock array, then they wait until all the Spectators have reached the Paddock, at the end the last Horse awakes the Spectators.
        Parameters:
        horseID - ID of the calling thread.
        pnk - Max step size.

      • proceedToStartLine

        public static void proceedToStartLine​()
        Called by the Horse to exit the Paddock.

      • goCheckHorses

        public static HorseInPaddock goCheckHorses​()
        Function in which the Spectator enters the Paddock. The last Spectator to enter wakes up the Horses. In this function the Spectator determines in which Horse they will bet.
        Returns:
        Returns the Horse in which the Spectator will bet.
